data.title: New and Terrific
data.text: I personally have not been here but my sister has several times and every time she goes, she tells me how great it was.  She says they have terrific food at a very reasonable price and entertainment.  Or you can just go there for drinks and appetizers.  She loves it.

data.title: Great addition to Cape Coral
data.text: If looking for entertainment this is the place to go.   Entertainment caters more to the retired but enjoyable for all.   The menu is varied but not a wow moment.  Average would be the best I could say.   But the combination is worth it's while.   The dining area is like a night club and it makes you feel you are out for an enjoyable evening.   Wait staff is stressed because everyone arrives close to show time so be patient.   They have good happy hour prices prior to the shows and happy hour mini food offerings are good.

data.title: Good show, OK food,service ?
data.text:
We had reservations to see the Joe Moreno piano tribute show.  Joe and his band put on a good show with few breaks. It was nonstop music.
It took a while for our waitress to take our orders and return with drinks. The alcohol content of the drinks seemed to vary.
Our waitress seemed a little slow and seemed flustered. She forgot items we requested and just didn't seem organized.
The food was had good flavor but was just warm not hot.
All at our table ate their food and had no complaints so maybe mine was the one that sat under the lights longest.
Dessert was good, I had red velvet cake.
Will give it another chance.
.

data.title: Entertainment was good, food was ok
data.text: The Rod Stewart Tribute was very good, however don't expect a 3 hour show as advertised. He stopped the show at 9:00, not 10:00 as advertised.  He does some comedy in between the songs so doesn't sing that many songs, but what he did sing is good. Since he cut the show by an hour, he should have cut the comedy out some and sang more. The service was slow, and the food was mediocre for the price, most of it was cold. They charge a $10 cover charge, which in my opinion should be cut in half if you don't get the full 3 hour show, and if you order food or drinks.

data.title: First Timers
data.text: Our first visit to Cape Cabaret. Tuesday 10/11, we are Gatlin's fans and attend their performances all over. Greatest entertainers in S.W. FL. The food and drink are reasonably priced and good. Our service this night was way below par and that is the reason for 4 stars. We will be back and if the service is bad will talk to mgt. We are very easy to please!

data.title: Eat, Drink, and Dance the Night Away
data.text: Cape Cabaret may be one of the best finds in Cape Coral!   This new venue used to be the Italian-American Club of Cape Coral.   It is now the "Cape Cabaret".   What a great place to go and eat, drink and dance.  Although the club is undergoing some renovations currently, it is always Very Clean, Has Good Food and Supplies some of the best entertainment in the area!   We searched for a night club atmosphere that could supply us with all of the above while at the same time providing an adult atmosphere that didn't keep you screaming to hear one another.    This is the place.   The food is reasonably priced and tasty, the atmosphere is great and the live music is second to none.  It's a great night for dancing every single night.   Singles, couples and adult family gatherings are perfect at the Cape.  The Management of this place is stellar.   Friendly and welcoming all of the time.    The wait staff is equally stellar.   If you've been there at least once, it's likely that your face will be remembered and your drink order will also be remembered if you get the same wait staff.   We simply love Cape Cabaret and we're quite sure you will also.   You will most likely want to make reservations well ahead of time to be sure that you can get in for the evening - especially with season coming upon us.  Don't miss this gem of a place if you like to Eat, Drink and Dance!

data.title: Entertaining
data.text: Cape Cabaret has live entertainment, we went to see a Tribute to Frankie Valle, the music was great and the food was even better...

data.title: Entertainment with dinner
data.text: We have been there three times and seen three different entertainers.  The food is good, and the entertainers have been enjoyable.  I will admit most of the crowd is older, but hey, old folks like to party a little too.

data.title: Server with an attitude
data.text: Dinner was good for the price, the entertainment was fantastic and the seating was good. The server had an attitude. There was a mix up with my dinner order; a dish was delivered to me that was NOT what i ordered, as it is one of my LEAST favorite things to eat,. the expediter was polite and returned it, The server, who claimed to be a professional came to the table and INSISTED that there was a problem and that I had ordered what he said. He said he would send the manager. I said that was fine. the manager never showed up, but the expediter brought me a dish that I had ordered with an apology, unfortunately, my potatoes were cold and my husband had finished his meal. After that, our server was less than attentive to us, dropping by a basket of rolls,sans butter, after the fact. I had to literally flag him down to order dessert and another drink. Fortunately, I was a professional server,and I tipped more than the amount deemed adequate because The expediter and bartender deserved their share. We will be back, but will be sure to ask for a different server.

data.title: night with elvis
data.text: 1st trip to cape cabaret; had been there when was italian club; big improvement; new sound system and lighting ; new renovation has given new atmosphere very positive;service was very good and fast; had appitizers and drinks very reasonable prices; the show was fantastic ;singer sang all of the elvis songs and then had a another set of oldies from other artists; will be back soon

data.title: Great Entertainment
data.text: This is one of our favorite places to go for some entertainment.  They always have something going on and it is usually very good and entertaining.  Nice variety on their menu.

data.title: Rude Manager Steve
data.text: I attended an event for Ladies with my MIL. This is her favorite place to go in the Cape and she has been a resident for 15 years. She goes probably twice a week or more. When we arrived we said "we are with the LOE group". Steve very rudely interrupted us and said "who or what the heck is LOE?"  The lady who owns Razzle Dazzle quickly cut him off and said "oh you're with the birthday gals" and led us to our table. Drinks are 1/2 price from 4-6. We arrived at 5:25 and each ordered wine. At 5:50 my MIL asked our server to bring us two more wines before happy hour was over. The server  replied "it's against FL law for me to allow you to order more wine when there is wine on the table". We were dumbfounded as many others had two drinks in front of them and asked for further clarification. Our server repeated the same message. We said fine and my MIL went to the bar for her glass of wine. When she returned to the table she has less than 2 sips in her first glass of wine. Steve the manager approached our table, placing his hands on my MIL's chair, leaning over her and stated loudly "it is NOT FL law, it is MY law that you may not order an additional glass of 1/2 price wine while you have wine in your glass on the table. You will not be permitted to do this again at this establishment". Imagine our horror and embarrassment. I wanted to leave and had one of my MIL' friends not been celebrating her birthday I would have left immediately. I will not be back as long as Steve is working and intimidating patrons. I don't care how cheap the price for average food is, nor how good the entertainment is, I will not be back.

data.title: New but still OLD
data.text: The place needs work . We were there for a few drinks and some apps. I'd call it average . The bartender was nice.  A group of friends had gone in July . They went for dinner and a show. Have to say they were right , it was not worth it. There are so many other great places in Cape Coral to go , this is definitely not one of them.

data.title: Disappointed!
data.text:
If you are looking for a nice place to relax and eat a nice meal, this is not the place! Waited a long time for our meals to arrive and a some of us never got what we ordered! We asked for additional rolls since we were starving. Service was very poor.
So if you are looking for a place to enjoy with your family/friends definitely go elsewhere!!

owner_response.author: capecabaret, Owner at Cape Cabaret, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Unfortunately this is not quiet the full story. We respect everyone's right to enjoy themselves but NOT at the expense of others. When we have a table that is unruly and disturbing other guests we will ask them to either refrain or leave. The manager spoke to them and their response was to continue in the same loud boisterous manner. The owner than went to the table and was meet with profanities. Yes they left without paying their bill and cursing while the neighboring tables thank us for getting rid of them.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: What a great place, atmosphere is nice, very clean and Refreshing, food was very good, entertainment great, friendly staff offering good service, prices very reasonable, nice venue for a couples Saturday night out.

data.title: Weds. Nite , wonderful surprise
data.text: Cape Cabaret is a fairly new place ,located in the former Italian American club.What a pleasant surprise. The drinks were good,and food was delicious.I didn't mention this was during happy hour 5-6 in the lounge. Then, we continued our evening in the main ballroom. The entertainment was excellent in both places Great Weds nite out . Would recommend highly

data.title: Friends, Fun & Del Prados
data.text: Not being here for a while, 3 couples decided at last minute to see the DelPrados and try their new food venue. Music was great as always! Food actually blew us away as the quality was substantially better than the last time. My only complaint is that though they are working at upgrading the interior, get the walls painted and remove the old carpet. Unfortunately it still looks like the "Other Place" and people still see this which does hurt the new image being created.

data.title: Great Night Out!
data.text: My friends and I recently heard about this venue and decided to try it.  We had a great night out!  We enjoyed our dinners which were reasonably priced.  Several of us had the pot roast which was delicious and came with a nice salad.  One of us had the chicken cordon bleu which she said was great.  The Gatlin Show was excellent!  They are incredible performers and I highly recommend seeing their show.  Cape Cabaret has entertainment most nights of the week.  We were able to dance all night on a large dance floor.  You can check their calendar on their website.  We have been back now twice since that night!

data.title: Don't Bother
data.text:
We went with somewhat high expectations. This is a fairly new establishment in downtown Cape Coral.The decor was a bit of a tip off: bland like a Holiday Inn lobby. The tables are arranged around a nice stage setting. Granted, we did have a table of eight, but the waiter came up, took our drink order rather promptly and then apologized that he had several other large tables "before us" and that it would be awhile before he took our dinner order. My drink was TOTALLY wrong-how a bartender thinks that he/she should put vermouth in a vodka martini is beyond me-even after I specified "nothing in it but a twist of lemon-NO VERMOUTH". UGH. The wait to place our dinner order was well over an hour. One guest got up and got bread for us. The wait for the food was about 45 minutes more. I'm guessing that the salad: two cherry tomatoes, iceberg lettuce, piece of red onion and sliver of cucumber, was made yesterday. Dressings were unceremoniously plopped in the center of the table in metal cups-our party had to pass them around to the right person.The food was for the most part, cold and unappetizing. Do not have the fried chicken. I was WAY overcooked, and the meat, bone dry. My boyfriend had the seafood pasta which he said was good.
The Rod Stewart impersonator was mediocre. We left early. On the way our the hostess asked us how we liked everything. I told her that the food was awful. She asked what was wrong. I didn't want to regale her with my critique. Horrible. We won't go back.

owner_response.author: capecabaret, Owner at Cape Cabaret, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Our sincere apology. The turnover for the Rod Stewart tribute show took us completely by surprise. We admit we were not prepared for the number of people who came out that night. We were completely overwhelmed by the turnout and we are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. Please be assured that we did not meet our expectations either and we take your comments very seriously.  We will make provisions to improve our service and food in the future and we will continue to work diligently to meet the standards that we have set for ourselves. We take you comments to heart and we are dedicated to making Cape Cabaret the number one place for food and entertainment.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: good appetizers at the bar and great music
data.text: We went there for a drink and appetizer specials before listening to the music.  The group was excellent and they sang for two hours.  Best part it was free.
